intro: Marrubium civice, commonly known as common horehound, is a perennial herb native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Marrubium civice has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
